intro: Secamone likiangensis, commonly known as the Yunnan secamone, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and has lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture. It produces small, round fruits that contain seeds covered in a fleshy aril. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
